top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship's Illinois farmland gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship's Farmland gravel, Rolling terrain forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship. Train it until it feels boring.
At Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
When someone attacks on Illinois farmland gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 3,000ft of climbing on Illinois farmland gravel does to your power file on race day.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Illinois farmland gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on illinois farmland gravel to build confidence. Expect: farmland gravel, rolling terrain, state championship.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of illinois farmland gravel in Manhattan, Illinois.
